original: Exhibit 10.8 Affiliate Program / Premium Affiliate Management General Terms and Conditions The following General Terms and Conditions are intended for (i) Web site owners (hereafter, "Affiliates") who wish to participate as Affiliates in the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 (governed by II. and IV. in these General Terms and Conditions) on the basis of these General Terms and Conditions and also for (ii) Software Publishers who distribute their software products as downloads using the services of element 5 GmbH, Vogelsanger Strasse 78, 50823 Cologne, Germany and its subsidiaries (together hereafter, "element 5") and who wish to make use of the additional service provided by element 5 (hereafter, "Affiliate Management", governed under III. and IV. in these General Terms and Conditions) for integration of the Affiliate Program provided by element 5.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.8 Affiliate Program / Premium Affiliate Management General Terms and Conditions

These General Terms and Conditions apply to (i) Web site owners (hereafter, "Affiliates") who elect to participate in the Affiliate Program offered by element 5 (as described in II. and IV. below) on their own accord, and also to (ii) Software Publishers who opt to utilize the download services of element 5 GmbH, Vogelsanger Strasse 78, 50823 Cologne, Germany and its subsidiaries (collectively hereafter, "element 5") and who seek the optional service of Affiliate Management (as outlined under III. and IV. below) for the incorporation of element 5's Affiliate Program.

In this revised version, the obligation to participate in the Affiliate Program has been shifted from being a requirement to an elective choice by the Affiliates. This modification weakens the obligation for Affiliates to join the program but still maintains the option for them to do so if they choose.

original: (3) The Affiliate shall produce a brief description for each activated product on its Web site. The Affiliate is responsible for the content, the style and the layout of this information. The Software Publisher can provide the Affiliate with graphics and text in an electronic format for use in describing the product, which the Affiliate shall use for the purpose of advertising the Products under the Agreement and links according to the instructions of the Software Publisher. The Affiliate should be aware that the product prices and availability may change at any time. It is not recommended that the price be listed on the Web site of the Affiliate. Maintenance of these product prices is possible only on the Web sites of the Software Publisher and the Publisher's corresponding site operated by element 5.
ollama_generated: (3) The Publisher grants the Affiliate permission to showcase a concise overview of each activated product on its official website. While the Affiliate retains responsibility for the content, style, and layout of this information, they are encouraged to utilize any graphical or textual resources provided by the Publisher in an electronic format for effective product promotion under this Agreement and appropriate linking mechanisms, as directed by the Publisher. The Affiliate is advised that product prices and availability may fluctuate without notice; it is at the discretion of the Affiliate whether to display these details on their website. The Publisher shall maintain up-to-date product pricing information exclusively on its own websites and the corresponding site operated by element 5.

original: Typographical, printing and computation errors on the Web site of the Affiliate shall be charged to said Affiliate.
modified: Any typographical, printing, or computational errors occurring on the Affiliate's website shall be rectified at the discretion of the Affiliate, with any associated costs incurred as a result being borne solely by us.

original: (2) Insofar as the referred end user accepts cookies when clicking on Affiliate's link, proceeds from orders will be taken into account which do arise within the lifespan (of max. 180 days) of the cookie(s) used and/ or possibly within the lifespan of a special action of the Software Publisher via integrated link.
modified: (2) For any end user who declines cookies upon clicking on the Affiliate's link, no orders placed within a period of 180 days after such refusal will be considered for revenue sharing. However, should the Software Publisher initiate a special action through an integrated link during this period, sales arising from that action may still be taken into account.

original: (4) The computation basis for determining the value of the Advertising Cost Compensation is calculated by the gross sales price (including taxes, shipping and handling, etc.) actually invoiced to the referred end user.
modified: (4) The basis for calculating the Advertising Cost Compensation shall be derived from the net sales price (excluding taxes, shipping, and handling costs) realized post any applicable deductions or discounts, following invoicing to the referred end user. In this context, it is understood that any adjustments made to the gross sales price by either party prior to, during, or after invoicing shall not impact the calculation of Advertising Cost Compensation.

original: (6) The payment of the Advertising Cost Compensation shall occur monthly insofar as the sum due exceeds a value of 100 EUR / 100 USD. If this is not the case, the sum due can be retained until a total value of at least 100 EUR / 100 USD is reached, at the latest, upon termination of the Affiliate's participation in the Program.
ollama_generated: (6) The Advertising Cost Compensation shall be paid monthly provided that the accumulated amount due is less than or equal to 100 EUR / 100 USD. Any excess amount will be carried forward and paid out upon reaching a total value of at least 100 EUR / 100 USD, which may occur prior to the termination of the Affiliate's participation in the Program. If the Affiliate chooses to terminate their participation before this threshold is reached, any retained compensation shall be paid out promptly.

original: (8) The invoicing is deemed to be approved if the Affiliate does not object in writing, including a statement of reasons, within four weeks.
ollama_generated: (8) If no written objection along with reasons is received from the Affiliate within four weeks following the invoice, such non-response shall be construed as an implicit approval of the invoiced amount.

original: (2) To generate revenue through this Program by means of sales referred by the Affiliate, the Affiliate, after completion of registration, must be activated by the Software Publisher in the Control Panel. The Software Publisher will be informed of the Affiliate's Source: SOUTHERN STAR ENERGY INC., SB-2/A, 12/2/2005 registration per e-mail with a request for the Affiliate's activation from element 5.
modified:
(2) For revenue generation through this Program, the Software Publisher may choose to activate the Affiliate upon completion of their registration in the Control Panel at their discretion. The Affiliate will be notified via email with instructions on how to facilitate their own activation from element 5 within the provided registration details by SOUTHERN STAR ENERGY INC., SB-2/A, 12/2/2005.

In this revised clause, the Affiliate's activation is no longer a requirement for revenue generation but rather an option at the Software Publisher's discretion. Additionally, the responsibility of activation has been shifted from the Software Publisher to the Affiliate.

original: MOREOVER, element 5 WILL ANNOUNNOUNCE ANY CHANGES TO THESE TERMS VIA E- MAIL. WHITHIN 14 DAYS OF THE ANNOUNCEMENT OF CHANGED PARTICIPATION TERMS, AFFILIATE AND SOFTWARE PUBLISHER MAY OBJECT TO SUCH CHANGES. IF NO OBJECTION IS RECEIVED DURING THIS TIME, THE PARTICIPANT IS DEEMED TO HAVE ACCEPTED THE CHANGES AND THEY WILL BECOME PART OF THE EXISTING RELATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENT.
ollama_generated: SUBSEQUENTLY, any amendments to these terms shall be communicated to the Affiliate and Software Publisher via email. Failure to object in writing within 14 days of receiving notification of the amended participation terms will be construed as acceptance by the Participant of such changes, which will then effectively become part of the agreement, incorporated therein without further notice.

original: § 3 Correspond enceont> Correspondence shall take place preferably via e-mail, which is accorded the same status as postal mail. Qualifying dates are always agreed as "Receipt by Recipient", unless otherwise noted. For e-mail, the receipt of the message on the destination mail server is deemed to be the time of reception.
ollama_generated:
§ 3 Communication Preference

Communications between the parties shall primarily be conducted electronically via email, however, where physical correspondence is necessary, it shall hold equal validity as postal mail. Dates for qualifying events are to be determined as "Delivery by Sender's Mail Server," unless explicitly specified otherwise. In regards to emails, delivery of the message to the sender's outbox is considered the time of transmission.

This revised clause maintains a similar meaning, but shifts the timing of receipt from the recipient to the sender in regard to emails, which may affect the interpretation and application of the provision in case of disputes or delays.

original: § 8 Termination of the agreement (1) When the agreement ends, all usage rights of the Affiliate and Software Publisher accorded by this agreement with regard to the provided logos or Web site contents expire.
ollama_generated: § 8 Expiration of Usage Rights upon Agreement Termination (1) Upon termination or expiry of this agreement, the non-transferable and non-exclusive rights granted to both Affiliate and Software Publisher with respect to the utilized logos or website contents shall no longer be valid. However, the parties are encouraged but not obligated to retain such materials in a manner that does not misrepresent the other party's products or services.

original: (2) Upon termination of the relationship under this agreement, the Affiliate is obligated to undertake all of the technical measures necessary to delete from its Web site all links that refer to the Web sites of element 5 or to the Software Publisher. The same applies upon termination of Affiliate Management for links of the Software Publisher that were established in connection with the participation in Affiliate Management on its Web site.
modified: (2) Upon termination of this agreement, the Affiliate shall be permitted but not required to remove, at its own discretion and pace, all links from its website that refer to the websites of element 5 or the Software Publisher. This same permission applies upon termination of Affiliate Management for links of the Software Publisher that were created in connection with participation in Affiliate Management on the Affiliate's website. The Affiliate shall not be held liable for any links remaining active post-termination if they cannot be removed within a reasonable timeframe due to technical or operational constraints beyond its control.

original: (3) element 5 is authorized to retain final payment for a reasonable time, minimum for 30 days after the end of the respective quarter, to ensure that the correct amount is paid.
ollama_generated: (3) element 5 shall have the discretion to withhold the final payment for an extended period, up to a maximum of 60 days following the conclusion of the respective quarter, in order to conduct a thorough review and verify the accuracy of the amount due.

original: Source: SOUTHERN STAR ENERGY INC., SB-2/A, 12/2/2005 Affiliate is only eligible to earn the Advertising Cost Compensation on sales of Software Publishers Products occurring during the term of this Agreement and fees earned up to the date termination will remain payable only if the related orders are not cancelled or returned. If the Advertising Cost Compensation was previously paid by element 5, it can be offset or invoiced to Affiliate at element 5's own discretion.
ollama_generated: The Recipient is entitled to receive the Advertising Cost Compensation solely for Software Publisher Products sales completed within the Agreement's duration. Any compensation earned before termination shall be payable, provided that the related orders have not been rescinded or returned. In the event that the Advertising Cost Compensation has already been paid under element 5, Southern Star Energy Inc. reserves the right to bill or offset this amount at its sole discretion, during or following the completion of the agreement term.
